trans-unit.source: Introduction to Apache Storm on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Apache Storm on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get an introduction to Apache Storm, and learn how you can use Storm on HDInsight to build real-time data analytics solutions in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Get an introduction to Apache Storm, and learn how you can use Storm on HDInsight to build real-time data analytics solutions in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm on HDInsight allows you to create distributed, real-time analytics solutions in the Azure environment by using <linkText>Apache Hadoop</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm on HDInsight allows you to create distributed, real-time analytics solutions in the Azure environment by using <linkText>Apache Hadoop</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm is a distributed, fault-tolerant, open-source computation system that allows you to process data in real-time with Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm is a distributed, fault-tolerant, open-source computation system that allows you to process data in real-time with Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Storm solutions can also provide guaranteed processing of data, with the ability to replay data that was not successfully processed the first time.
trans-unit.target: Storm solutions can also provide guaranteed processing of data, with the ability to replay data that was not successfully processed the first time.

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm on HDInsight is a managed cluster integrated into the Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm on HDInsight is a managed cluster integrated into the Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: It provides the following key benefits:
trans-unit.target: It provides the following key benefits:

trans-unit.source: Performs as a managed service with an SLA of 99.9% up time
trans-unit.target: Performs as a managed service with an SLA of 99.9% up time

trans-unit.source: Use the language of your choice: Provides support for Storm components written in Java, C#, and Python
trans-unit.target: Use the language of your choice: Provides support for Storm components written in Java, C#, and Python

trans-unit.source: Supports a mix of programming languages: Read data using Java, then process it using C#
trans-unit.target: Supports a mix of programming languages: Read data using Java, then process it using C#

trans-unit.source: Use the Trident Java interface to create Storm topologies that support "exactly once" processing of messages, "transactional" datastore persistence, and a set of common stream analytics operations
trans-unit.target: Use the Trident Java interface to create Storm topologies that support "exactly once" processing of messages, "transactional" datastore persistence, and a set of common stream analytics operations

trans-unit.source: Includes built-in scale-up and scale-down features: Scale an HDInsight cluster with no impact to running Storm topologies
trans-unit.target: Includes built-in scale-up and scale-down features: Scale an HDInsight cluster with no impact to running Storm topologies

trans-unit.source: Integrate with other Azure services, including Event Hub, Azure Virtual Network, SQL Database, Blob storage, and DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: Integrate with other Azure services, including Event Hub, Azure Virtual Network, SQL Database, Blob storage, and DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: Combine the capabilities of multiple HDInsight clusters by using Azure Virtual Network: Create analytic pipelines that use HDInsight, HBase, or Hadoop clusters
trans-unit.target: Combine the capabilities of multiple HDInsight clusters by using Azure Virtual Network: Create analytic pipelines that use HDInsight, HBase, or Hadoop clusters

trans-unit.source: For a list of companies that are using Apache Storm for their real-time analytics solutions, see <linkText>Companies Using Apache Storm</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of companies that are using Apache Storm for their real-time analytics solutions, see <linkText>Companies Using Apache Storm</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To get started using Storm, see <linkText>Get started with Storm on HDInsight[gettingstarted]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To get started using Storm, see <linkText>Get started with Storm on HDInsight[gettingstarted]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can provision a new Storm on HDInsight cluster in minutes.
trans-unit.target: You can provision a new Storm on HDInsight cluster in minutes.

trans-unit.source: Specify the cluster name, size, administrator account, and the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specify the cluster name, size, administrator account, and the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Azure will create the cluster, including sample topologies and a web-management dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Azure will create the cluster, including sample topologies and a web-management dashboard.

trans-unit.source: You can also provision Storm clusters by using the <linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can also provision Storm clusters by using the <linkText>Azure CLI</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Within 15 minutes of submitting the request, you will have a new Storm cluster running and ready for your first real-time analytics pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Within 15 minutes of submitting the request, you will have a new Storm cluster running and ready for your first real-time analytics pipeline.

trans-unit.source: If you use Visual Studio, the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio allow you to create C# and hybrid C#/Java topologies, and then submit them to your Storm on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you use Visual Studio, the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio allow you to create C# and hybrid C#/Java topologies, and then submit them to your Storm on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm Project creation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm Project creation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio also provides an interface that allows you to monitor and manage Storm topologies on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio also provides an interface that allows you to monitor and manage Storm topologies on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For an example of using the HDInsight Tools to create a Storm application, see <linkText>Develop C# Storm topologies with the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of using the HDInsight Tools to create a Storm application, see <linkText>Develop C# Storm topologies with the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio, see <linkText>Get started using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio, see <linkText>Get started using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Each Storm on HDInsight cluster also provides a web-based Storm Dashboard that allows you to submit, monitor, and manage Storm topologies running on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Each Storm on HDInsight cluster also provides a web-based Storm Dashboard that allows you to submit, monitor, and manage Storm topologies running on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Storm dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Storm dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the Storm Dashboard, see <linkText>Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the Storm Dashboard, see <linkText>Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Storm on HDInsight also provides easy integration with Azure Event Hubs through the Event Hub Spout.
trans-unit.target: Storm on HDInsight also provides easy integration with Azure Event Hubs through the Event Hub Spout.

trans-unit.source: This is available on each storm cluster at %STORM_HOME%\examples\eventhubspout\eventhubs-storm-spout-0.9-jar-with-dependencies.jar.
trans-unit.target: This is available on each storm cluster at %STORM_HOME%\examples\eventhubspout\eventhubs-storm-spout-0.9-jar-with-dependencies.jar.

trans-unit.source: For examples of using this spout in a Storm topology, see <linkText>Getting started with Event Hubs</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Analyzing sensor data with Storm and HBase</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of using this spout in a Storm topology, see <linkText>Getting started with Event Hubs</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Analyzing sensor data with Storm and HBase</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm always guarantees that each incoming message will be fully processed, even when the data analysis is spread over hundreds of nodes.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm always guarantees that each incoming message will be fully processed, even when the data analysis is spread over hundreds of nodes.

trans-unit.source: The Nimbus node provides similar functionality to the Hadoop JobTracker, and it assigns tasks to other nodes in the cluster through Zookeeper.
trans-unit.target: The Nimbus node provides similar functionality to the Hadoop JobTracker, and it assigns tasks to other nodes in the cluster through Zookeeper.

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes provide coordination for the cluster and facilitate communication between Nimbus and the Supervisor process on the worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes provide coordination for the cluster and facilitate communication between Nimbus and the Supervisor process on the worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: If one processing node goes down, the Nimbus node is informed, and it assigns the task and associated data to another node.
trans-unit.target: If one processing node goes down, the Nimbus node is informed, and it assigns the task and associated data to another node.

trans-unit.source: The default configuration for Apache Storm is to have only one Nimbus node.
trans-unit.target: The default configuration for Apache Storm is to have only one Nimbus node.

trans-unit.source: Storm on HDInsight runs two Nimbus nodes.
trans-unit.target: Storm on HDInsight runs two Nimbus nodes.

trans-unit.source: If the primary node fails, the HDInsight cluster will switch to the secondary node while the primary node is recovered.
trans-unit.target: If the primary node fails, the HDInsight cluster will switch to the secondary node while the primary node is recovered.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram of nimbus, zookeeper, and supervisor</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram of nimbus, zookeeper, and supervisor</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Although you can specify the number of nodes in your cluster during creation, you may want to grow or shrink the cluster to match workload.
trans-unit.target: Although you can specify the number of nodes in your cluster during creation, you may want to grow or shrink the cluster to match workload.

trans-unit.source: All HDInsight clusters allow you to change the number of nodes in the cluster, even while processing data.
trans-unit.target: All HDInsight clusters allow you to change the number of nodes in the cluster, even while processing data.

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of new nodes added through scaling, you will need to rebalance topologies started before the cluster size was increased.
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of new nodes added through scaling, you will need to rebalance topologies started before the cluster size was increased.

trans-unit.source: Storm on HDInsight comes with full enterprise-level 24/7 support.
trans-unit.target: Storm on HDInsight comes with full enterprise-level 24/7 support.

trans-unit.source: Storm on HDInsight also has an SLA of 99.9%.
trans-unit.target: Storm on HDInsight also has an SLA of 99.9%.

trans-unit.source: That means we guarantee that the cluster will have external connectivity at least 99.9% of the time.
trans-unit.target: That means we guarantee that the cluster will have external connectivity at least 99.9% of the time.

trans-unit.source: The following are some common scenarios for which you might use Apache storm on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The following are some common scenarios for which you might use Apache storm on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For information about real-world scenarios, read <linkText>How companies are using Storm</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about real-world scenarios, read <linkText>How companies are using Storm</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Internet of Things (IoT)
trans-unit.target: Internet of Things (IoT)

trans-unit.source: Fraud detection
trans-unit.target: Fraud detection

trans-unit.source: Social analytics
trans-unit.target: Social analytics

trans-unit.source: Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)
trans-unit.target: Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)

trans-unit.source: Network monitoring
trans-unit.target: Network monitoring

trans-unit.source: Search
trans-unit.target: Search

trans-unit.source: Mobile engagement
trans-unit.target: Mobile engagement

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm runs topologies instead of the MapReduce jobs that you may be familiar with in HDInsight or Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm runs topologies instead of the MapReduce jobs that you may be familiar with in HDInsight or Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: A Storm on HDInsight cluster contains two types of nodes: head nodes that run Nimbus and worker nodes that run Supervisor.
trans-unit.target: A Storm on HDInsight cluster contains two types of nodes: head nodes that run Nimbus and worker nodes that run Supervisor.

trans-unit.source: Nimbus: Similar to the JobTracker in Hadoop, it is responsible for distributing code throughout the cluster, assigning tasks to virtual machines, and monitoring for failure.
trans-unit.target: Nimbus: Similar to the JobTracker in Hadoop, it is responsible for distributing code throughout the cluster, assigning tasks to virtual machines, and monitoring for failure.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight provides two Nimbus nodes, so there is no single point of failure for Storm on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: HDInsight provides two Nimbus nodes, so there is no single point of failure for Storm on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Supervisor: The supervisor for each worker node is responsible for starting and stopping worker processes on the node.
trans-unit.target: Supervisor: The supervisor for each worker node is responsible for starting and stopping worker processes on the node.

trans-unit.source: Worker process: Runs a subset of a topology.
trans-unit.target: Worker process: Runs a subset of a topology.

trans-unit.source: A running topology is distributed across many worker processes throughout the cluster.
trans-unit.target: A running topology is distributed across many worker processes throughout the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Topology: Defines a graph of computation that processes streams of data.
trans-unit.target: Topology: Defines a graph of computation that processes streams of data.

trans-unit.source: Unlike MapReduce jobs, topologies run until you stop them.
trans-unit.target: Unlike MapReduce jobs, topologies run until you stop them.

trans-unit.source: Stream: An unbound collection of tuples.
trans-unit.target: Stream: An unbound collection of tuples.

trans-unit.source: Streams are produced by spouts and bolts, and they are consumed by bolts.
trans-unit.target: Streams are produced by spouts and bolts, and they are consumed by bolts.

trans-unit.source: Tuple: A named list of dynamically typed values.
trans-unit.target: Tuple: A named list of dynamically typed values.

trans-unit.source: Spout: Consumes data from a data source and emits one or more streams.
trans-unit.target: Spout: Consumes data from a data source and emits one or more streams.

trans-unit.source: In many cases, data is read from a queue, such as Kafka, Azure Service Bus queues, or Event hubs.
trans-unit.target: In many cases, data is read from a queue, such as Kafka, Azure Service Bus queues, or Event hubs.

trans-unit.source: The queue ensures that data is persisted if there is an outage.
trans-unit.target: The queue ensures that data is persisted if there is an outage.

trans-unit.source: Bolt: Consumes streams, performs processing on tuples, and may emit streams.
trans-unit.target: Bolt: Consumes streams, performs processing on tuples, and may emit streams.

trans-unit.source: Bolts are also responsible for writing data to external storage, such as a queue, HDInsight, HBase, a blob, or other data store.
trans-unit.target: Bolts are also responsible for writing data to external storage, such as a queue, HDInsight, HBase, a blob, or other data store.

trans-unit.source: Apache Thrift: A software framework for scalable cross-language service development.
trans-unit.target: Apache Thrift: A software framework for scalable cross-language service development.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to build services that work between C++, Java, Python, PHP, Ruby, Erlang, Perl, Haskell, C#, Cocoa, JavaScript, Node.js, Smalltalk, and other languages.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to build services that work between C++, Java, Python, PHP, Ruby, Erlang, Perl, Haskell, C#, Cocoa, JavaScript, Node.js, Smalltalk, and other languages.

trans-unit.source: Nimbus is a Thrift service, and a topology is a Thrift definition, so it is possible to develop topologies using a variety of programming languages.
trans-unit.target: Nimbus is a Thrift service, and a topology is a Thrift definition, so it is possible to develop topologies using a variety of programming languages.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Storm components, see the <linkText>Storm tutorial[apachetutorial]</linkText><title></title> at apache.org.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Storm components, see the <linkText>Storm tutorial[apachetutorial]</linkText><title></title> at apache.org.

trans-unit.source: The Storm on HDInsight cluster provides support for C#, Java, and Python.
trans-unit.target: The Storm on HDInsight cluster provides support for C#, Java, and Python.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio allow .NET developers to design and implement a topology in C#.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio allow .NET developers to design and implement a topology in C#.

trans-unit.source: You can also create hybrid topologies that use Java and C# components.
trans-unit.target: You can also create hybrid topologies that use Java and C# components.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Develop C# topologies for Apache Storm on HDInsight using Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Develop C# topologies for Apache Storm on HDInsight using Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Most Java examples you encounter will be plain Java or Trident.
trans-unit.target: Most Java examples you encounter will be plain Java or Trident.

trans-unit.source: Trident is a high-level abstraction that makes it easier to do things such as joins, aggregations, grouping, and filtering.
trans-unit.target: Trident is a high-level abstraction that makes it easier to do things such as joins, aggregations, grouping, and filtering.

trans-unit.source: However, Trident acts on batches of tuples, whereas a raw Java solution processes a stream one tuple at a time.
trans-unit.target: However, Trident acts on batches of tuples, whereas a raw Java solution processes a stream one tuple at a time.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Trident, see the <linkText>Trident tutorial</linkText><title></title> at apache.org.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Trident, see the <linkText>Trident tutorial</linkText><title></title> at apache.org.

trans-unit.source: For examples of raw Java and Trident topologies, see the %storm_home%\contrib\storm-starter directory on your HDInsight Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: For examples of raw Java and Trident topologies, see the %storm_home%\contrib\storm-starter directory on your HDInsight Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: Storm can provide different levels of guaranteed message processing.
trans-unit.target: Storm can provide different levels of guaranteed message processing.

trans-unit.source: For example, a basic Storm application can guarantee at-least-once processing, and Trident can guarantee exactly-once processing.
trans-unit.target: For example, a basic Storm application can guarantee at-least-once processing, and Trident can guarantee exactly-once processing.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Guarantees on data processing</linkText><title></title> at apache.org.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Guarantees on data processing</linkText><title></title> at apache.org.

trans-unit.source: The pattern of reading an input tuple, emitting zero or more tuples, and then acking the input tuple immediately at the end of the execute method is very common, and Storm provides the <linkText>IBasicBolt</linkText><title></title> interface to automate this pattern.
trans-unit.target: The pattern of reading an input tuple, emitting zero or more tuples, and then acking the input tuple immediately at the end of the execute method is very common, and Storm provides the <linkText>IBasicBolt</linkText><title></title> interface to automate this pattern.

trans-unit.source: Joining two streams of data will vary between applications.
trans-unit.target: Joining two streams of data will vary between applications.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could join each tuple from multiple streams into one new stream, or you could join only batches of tuples for a specific window.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could join each tuple from multiple streams into one new stream, or you could join only batches of tuples for a specific window.

trans-unit.source: Either way, joining can be accomplished by using <linkText>fieldsGrouping</linkText><title></title>, which is a way of defining how tuples are routed to bolts.
trans-unit.target: Either way, joining can be accomplished by using <linkText>fieldsGrouping</linkText><title></title>, which is a way of defining how tuples are routed to bolts.

trans-unit.source: In the following Java example, fieldsGrouping is used to route tuples that originate from components "1", "2", and "3" to the MyJoiner bolt.
trans-unit.target: In the following Java example, fieldsGrouping is used to route tuples that originate from components "1", "2", and "3" to the MyJoiner bolt.

trans-unit.source: Batching can be accomplished several ways.
trans-unit.target: Batching can be accomplished several ways.

trans-unit.source: With a basic Storm Java topology, you might use simple counter to batch X number of tuples before emitting them, or use an internal timing mechanism known as a "tick tuple" to emit a batch every X seconds.
trans-unit.target: With a basic Storm Java topology, you might use simple counter to batch X number of tuples before emitting them, or use an internal timing mechanism known as a "tick tuple" to emit a batch every X seconds.

trans-unit.source: For an example of using tick tuples, see <linkText>Analyzing sensor data with Storm and HBase on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of using tick tuples, see <linkText>Analyzing sensor data with Storm and HBase on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Trident, it is based on processing batches of tuples.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Trident, it is based on processing batches of tuples.

trans-unit.source: In-memory caching is often used as a mechanism for speeding up processing because it keeps frequently used assets in memory.
trans-unit.target: In-memory caching is often used as a mechanism for speeding up processing because it keeps frequently used assets in memory.

trans-unit.source: Because a topology is distributed across multiple nodes, and multiple processes within each node, you should consider using <linkText>fieldsGrouping</linkText><title></title> to ensure that tuples containing the fields that are used for cache lookup are always routed to the same process.
trans-unit.target: Because a topology is distributed across multiple nodes, and multiple processes within each node, you should consider using <linkText>fieldsGrouping</linkText><title></title> to ensure that tuples containing the fields that are used for cache lookup are always routed to the same process.

trans-unit.source: This avoids duplication of cache entries across processes.
trans-unit.target: This avoids duplication of cache entries across processes.

trans-unit.source: When your topology depends on calculating a "top N" value, such as the top 5 trends on Twitter, you should calculate the top N value in parallel and then merge the output from those calculations into a global value.
trans-unit.target: When your topology depends on calculating a "top N" value, such as the top 5 trends on Twitter, you should calculate the top N value in parallel and then merge the output from those calculations into a global value.

trans-unit.source: This can be done by using <linkText>fieldsGrouping</linkText><title></title> to route by field to the parallel bolts (which partitions the data by field value), and then route to a bolt that globally determines the top N value.
trans-unit.target: This can be done by using <linkText>fieldsGrouping</linkText><title></title> to route by field to the parallel bolts (which partitions the data by field value), and then route to a bolt that globally determines the top N value.

trans-unit.source: For an example of this, see the <linkText>RollingTopWords</linkText><title></title> example.
trans-unit.target: For an example of this, see the <linkText>RollingTopWords</linkText><title></title> example.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about real-time analytics solutions with Apache Storm in HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: Learn more about real-time analytics solutions with Apache Storm in HDInsight:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Getting Started with Storm on HDInsight[gettingstarted]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
